author: pcaversaccio
content:
I got a question re the `0x02` upgrade for the validator withdrawal credentials. My understanding is that I can upgrade an existing `0x01` address to a `0x02` address by setting `source==target` in the consolidation request. What I don't understand is if I can also change the EL withdrawal address set from the `0x00` to `0x01` upgrade which is part of the `0x01...`. So for example, I have the withdrawal credentials `0x010000000000000000000000a684e47a0906f320960fa0487ace021535ad0e54` for a validator `X` and I want to upgrade that one to `0x02`. My understanding is that the `0xa684e47a0906f320960fa0487ace021535ad0e54` address cannot be changed for validator `X`, just the prefix. Is this correct?

Also, do current CL clients initialise new validator withdrawal credentials after pectra with `0x02` or `0x01`?

author: .paulharris
content: Currently the execution address in 0x01 credentials is permanent, so you are allowed to alter the type to 0x02, but there can be no changes made to the execution address via any current mechanism. To change the execution address you would need to exit and create a new validator, and that could be created with 0x02, or changed after itâ€™s created.

author: .paulharris
content: It would be when making a deposit, assuming the tool allows it. The CL are not really involved with withdrawal addresses very much

author: pcaversaccio
content:
ok this confirms my understanding, thx a lot. Do you know the answer to this as well:
> Also, do current CL clients initialise new validator withdrawal credentials after pectra with `0x02` or `0x01`?

author: .paulharris
content: So the deposits are generated when you generate keys, not via CL client and they likely allow you initialising with 02 credentials

author: pcaversaccio
content: right - this would make sense; thx for the feedback

author: remyroy
content: Once you set a withdrawal address, you cannot change it. There are 2 ways of setting up a withdrawal address : performing the BLS to execution change on the CL going from type 0 to type 1 or depositing for a new validator with a baked in withdrawal address either with a type 1 or type 2 validator.

author: remyroy
content: When depositing for a new validator, you still have the ability to choose a type 0, type 1 or type 2 validator.

author: remyroy
content: The CL or the concensus client do not initialize any validator. The starting point of the validator creation is the deposit and the various tools that help you perform this deposit. For instance, you can use ethstaker-deposit-cli to create your deposit data with a brand new type 2 validator.

author: remyroy
content: There is potentially a third way of *setting* a different withdrawal address if you are willing to stretch the definition of *setting*. You can consolidate the balance of a type 1 or type 2 validator into a *third-party* type 2 validator effectively changing the withdrawal address of those staked ETH.
